Appending Surv objects

Source: R/rbind.Surv.R
rbind.Surv.Rd

rbind method for Surv objects

Usage

# S3 method for class 'Surv'
rbind(...)

Arguments

...

Surv objects

Value

Surv object

Author

Klaus K. Holst

Examples


y <- yl <- yr <- rnorm(10)
yl[1:5] <- NA; yr[6:10] <- NA
S1 <- survival::Surv(yl,yr,type="interval2")
S2 <- survival::Surv(y,y>0,type="right")
S3 <- survival::Surv(y,y<0,type="left")

rbind(S1,S1)
#>  [1]  1.13176967- -1.30350912- -0.65058095- -0.98595731-  1.66846313-
#>  [6]  0.08767241+  0.82288646+  0.71012082+  0.51054011+ -0.72494378+
#> [11]  1.13176967- -1.30350912- -0.65058095- -0.98595731-  1.66846313-
#> [16]  0.08767241+  0.82288646+  0.71012082+  0.51054011+ -0.72494378+
rbind(S2,S2)
#>  [1]  1.13176967  -1.30350912+ -0.65058095+ -0.98595731+  1.66846313 
#>  [6]  0.08767241   0.82288646   0.71012082   0.51054011  -0.72494378+
#> [11]  1.13176967  -1.30350912+ -0.65058095+ -0.98595731+  1.66846313 
#> [16]  0.08767241   0.82288646   0.71012082   0.51054011  -0.72494378+
rbind(S3,S3)
#>  [1]  1.13176967- -1.30350912  -0.65058095  -0.98595731   1.66846313-
#>  [6]  0.08767241-  0.82288646-  0.71012082-  0.51054011- -0.72494378 
#> [11]  1.13176967- -1.30350912  -0.65058095  -0.98595731   1.66846313-
#> [16]  0.08767241-  0.82288646-  0.71012082-  0.51054011- -0.72494378
